comments.body: @jakirkham this is what pypi said.. did not read it though... :-p

Yep, I looked at the license file and would generally agree. It was a BSD 3-Clause license with an additional (not advertising) clause similar in form (not necessarily meaning) to the HDF5 license. Though there are parts under other licenses like PSF 2 and some BSD like license for Unicode stuff. We could list those out, but "BSD Like" seems sufficient to cover those generally (at least to me).

We could ask others if they have a preference.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@about:
  home: https://github.com/kjd/idna
  license: BSD Like
  license_file: LICENSE.rst
  summary: Internationalized Domain Names in Applications (IDNA).
